alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Murray; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Catoosa, north central Murray and northeastern Whitfield Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Red Clay State Park, or 12 miles east of Ringgold, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Varnell, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta and Beaverdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
